definition: military government
(bound form) army/military
political/politics/government
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: The junta has threatened to use force, and the NMSP no longer trusts the generals.
sentences.chinese: 軍政府威脅要使用武力，新孟邦黨不再信任將軍們。

sentences.english: Instead, it will make it even cagier in handling the offers of aid.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它會令軍政府更加謹慎地對待援助問題。

sentences.english: During the past month, the junta has tighten security in the town and reenforced troops.
sentences.chinese: 在過去一個月裏，軍政府已加強安全和增強軍隊。

sentences.english: Without Suu Kyi, nobody is going to believe the junta.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有蘇姬，沒有人會相信軍政府。

sentences.english: The junta fell less than a year later.
sentences.chinese: 不到一年後，軍政府即告倒臺。

sentences.english: The junta will leave no stones unturned to win the elections.
sentences.chinese: 軍政府將不留餘地務必努力贏得選舉。

sentences.english: The military government repressed the striking workers.
sentences.chinese: 軍政府鎮壓了罷工的工人。

sentences.english: Even NLD efforts were severely curtailed by the junta.
sentences.chinese: 即使全民盟也受到了軍政府的嚴重削弱。

sentences.english: Ye Myint is the regime's chief negotiator in talks with the ceasefire groups.
sentences.chinese: 葉敏是軍政府與停火談判的首席代表。

sentences.english: Leading members of the Burmese military junta are scheduled to meet in the coming week in Naypyidaw.
sentences.chinese: 緬甸軍政府領導成員計劃於下週在內比都召開會議。

sentences.english: Is KIO for democratic war against evil democracy of junta?
sentences.chinese: 克欽獨立組織應否開戰反擊軍政府邪惡民主？

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen wins an election for China republic military government generalissimo.
sentences.chinese: 孫中山當選爲中華民國軍政府大元帥。

sentences.english: DKBA Brigades 7 and 9, however, appear to be accepting the junta's BGF order.
sentences.chinese: 但是7旅9旅似乎是接受軍政府的改編命令。

sentences.english: The military government dissolved the injunction.
The regime has ignored her repeated offers for national reconciliation dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 她反覆要求的民族和解對話被軍政府置之不理。

sentences.english: The NMSP signed a cease-fire agreement with the regime in 1995.
sentences.chinese: 新孟邦黨於1995年同軍政府簽署了一份停火協議。

definition: provisional government
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
Wuchang Uprising of October 10th, 1911, which led to Sun Yat-sen's Xinhai Revolution and the fall of the Qing dynasty
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
united front
old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
general headquarters
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
